meanings.definition: Not forming an essential or inherent part of a thing; coming or operating from outside.
meanings.sent1: The extrinsic factors, like the weather, affected the outcome.
meanings.sent2: The extrinsic decorations made the room look more festive.
meanings.sent3: She joked that her extrinsic sense of direction always led her astray.
meanings.sent4: The extrinsic noise of the city was a constant background hum.
meanings.sent5: The extrinsic smell of fresh cookies drew everyone to the kitchen.

meanings.definition: Originating from or on the outside; external.
meanings.sent1: His extrinsic knowledge of the topic came from reading books.
meanings.sent2: The extrinsic light from the streetlamp illuminated the path.
meanings.sent3: The extrinsic idea of a talking dog amused the children.
meanings.sent4: Her extrinsic beauty shone like a beacon in the crowd.
meanings.sent5: The extrinsic sound of laughter filled the room with joy.
